page.title: 09Public Houses-1
page.content: {The King Charles}is a very popular pub.It was built in 1937 and lies at the north eastern corner of the village at the junction of Springvale Road and Lovedone Lane. It was visited in war time by members of the Fleet Air Arm stationed at H.M.S. Kestrel at nearby Worthy Down. It was known then as the Springvale Hotel and renamed in 1972. The present landlord keeps the premises in a good clean condition, the outside looking very smart in its new coat of paint and hand painted sign of King Charles.{The Cart and Horses}was built during the Tudor times in 1540. It started as an inn where weary travellers stopped for food, drink and a night's sleep before continuing with their pilgrimage. Nowadays it is a popular pub, well known for its good food.
